banners.priority: ✅ PHASE 1+2 COMPLETE: 6 data layers + scorecard shipped. Property Tax (3.3x variance), Labor Availability (tightness scoring), Temp Staffing (hidden markup). Phase 3 next: Transportation Index, Insurance Premium Proxy, Utility Territory Rates.

cards.title: Dollarize Site Scorecard (v0.4) + Tax Incentives Layer
cards.description: Converted scorecard from rates/grades to actual $/yr per site. Added WAREHOUSE_DEFAULTS (200K SF, 150 workers, 9 kWh/SF, 1500 MCF gas, $20M value, 30% temp penetration, 45% agency markup). dollarize_scorecard() computes: labor (workers x wage), electricity (SF x kWh x rate), gas (MCF x rate), property tax (direct), temp markup (temps x wage x 45%). HTML now shows two tables: TFOC dollar comparison (top) + rate detail (bottom) with site-vs-site deltas and cheapest-site badges. Tax incentives layer added (Layer 7) with GA JTC tier lookup and 5-state reference data. Incentives show as green negative cost line in TFOC. Result: Atlanta $8.1M vs Seattle $10.5M vs Moreno Valley $11.4M — the CFO output.

cards.title: n8n Red Team Pipeline + Report Redesign
cards.description: Built red_team.py CLI: fires n8n webhook (o3 + Claude Opus + Grok-3 → DeepSeek R1), polls via execution ID, renders premium HTML report. Fixed polling timeout (ID-based vs timestamp), webhook error visibility. Redesigned report template: structured markdown parser, severity color-coded cards, expandable findings, filter pills, copy-to-clipboard, scroll progress, blind spot hero. Switched to light mode matching dashboard palette (#f8f7f4 cream, warm gray borders, matching severity chips). Feb 17.

cards.title: Wispr Flow Deep Dive & Mic Lock Fix
cards.description: Full audit of Wispr Flow voice dictation: Ctrl+Space conflict check (clean), system resource check (clean), config.json diagnostic analysis revealing 38 mic switches → 96 cancelled transcripts → 64 paste failures. Root cause: overrideAudioDeviceId set to dynamic 'communications' instead of specific device. Fix: locked to Blue Snowball device hash. Drafted feedback for Wispr Flow team (email, X, roadmap). Feb 17.

cards.title: Dashboard Deploy Sync Protocol
cards.description: Cloned demko-dashboard deploy repo, synced kanban_dashboard.html → index.html, pushed to GitHub Pages. Fixed stale deploy missing Done-on-top layout, leaderboard toggle, chain arrows, and scoring badges. Feb 16.

cards.title: 3D Scoring Framework
cards.description: Replaced simple impact/effort ROI with Amplification × Creative / Effort in meta_learning_loop.py. New dimensions: Amplification (1-10, downstream outputs affected), Creative (1-10, novel thinking vs mechanical). Updated dataclass, Stage 2 prompt, output formatting, and memory capture. Feb 16.

cards.title: End-to-End Stress Test
cards.description: Full pipeline validated: /ci-swarm (6 competitors, 87KB report) → strategic-reviewer CUV audit (3 rounds, 6.6→9.0/10) → hooks verified (audit logger, file protection, session context). Found & fixed 2 gaps: wired CUV Stop Gate + Anti-Rationalization Gate into Stop hooks. Feb 16.

cards.title: Write Flo Health Project Instructions
cards.description: CLAUDE_FloHealth.md — full board intelligence playbook derived from 7 corpus files. Competitor table, 6 strategic themes, Synthetic Council config, artifact standards, demo readiness checklist. Built autonomously while user was away. Feb 16.

cards.title: End-of-Day Handoff Protocol
cards.description: HANDOFF_PROTOCOL.md — task block template, model selection guide, P1-P5 priority ranking, context payload guide, morning verification checklist, sample Flo CI sweep, anti-patterns. Built by parallel agent. Feb 16.

cards.title: Tighten Kill Filter Prompts
cards.description: 3 fixes in extract_recording_feedback.py: cross-claim deduplication (Kill 1), 16h effort ceiling hard gate (Kill 4), metrics-as-features bug with regex safety net. 34 false BUILD candidates → 7 real ones. Built by parallel agent. Feb 16.

cards.title: P0 — Hooks Layer (Deterministic Enforcement)
cards.description: CUV Stop Gate, Audit Logger, File Protection, Anti-Rationalization Gate, Session Context Injection, PreCompact Backup, Windows Notification. All 7 hooks wired in settings.local.json. Feb 16.

cards.title: P1 — Skills Layer (One-Command Workflows)

cards.title: P0 — Understand CLAUDE.md v1.6→v1.8 Evolution

Key changes: (1) CUV restructured from 5-item checklist to 4-dimension + frontier retro-check lens model, (2) Frontier Whisper added for TIER 1 — passive frontier awareness on tactical tasks, (3) CRITIQUE_FRAMEWORK.md created with full convergence criteria, (4) FRONTIER_SIGNALS.md referenced as evidence source, (5) 47-finding red team (4 models) drove v1.8. Files to review: INTELLIGENCE_DELTA.md (full changelog), CLAUDE.md Rule 3 (CUV), CLAUDE.md Rule 4 (Frontier Whisper), CRITIQUE_FRAMEWORK.md. Feb 16. Reviewed Feb 17.

Current state: .claude.json has 'mcpServers': {} at global level but gdrive is only configured under project 'C:/Demko_Local_Project/Demko Meta OS 2'. Also reformatted API key Google Doc with full inventory (added 3 missing keys: Poe, Brave, Firecrawl). Feb 17.

cards.title: Launch Button → Claude Code CLI

Fixed Feb 17: changed -p (print mode, blank screen) to interactive mode. Tested and working — Windows Terminal opens with Claude Code session pre-loaded with task prompt.

cards.title: Phase 2 — Memory Architecture Split (3-Tier)
cards.description: MEMORY.md split into 3 tiers: (1) RULES layer (<150 lines, loaded into prompt), (2) KNOWLEDGE topic files (linked, fetched on demand), (3) LEARNINGS.md (append-only session lessons, not in prompt). Session-close protocol updated to route lessons to LEARNINGS.md. Self-referential TIER 2 rule added. Feb 17.
cards.launch_prompt: In C:\Demko_Local_Project\Demko Meta OS 2 and ~/.claude/projects/.../memory/: Phase 2 Memory Architecture Split. (1) Create LEARNINGS.md — move all session lessons from MEMORY.md here, append-only format with dates. (2) Slim MEMORY.md to RULES ONLY — preferences, shorthand commands, stack info, protocol pointers. Target <150 lines. (3) Verify all topic files (llm_aggregator_research.md etc) are linked in Reference Files section. (4) Add self-referential rule at top of MEMORY.md: 'Any edit to this file is TIER 2 (CUV required).' (5) Update session-close protocol to route lessons → LEARNINGS.md, not MEMORY.md. (6) Test: start new session, verify MEMORY.md loads clean, verify topic files are findable.

cards.title: Build in Public — Daily Auto-Post to X
cards.description: Full implementation: build_in_public.py (git log → AI draft → Tweepy post → archive), .env with X API keys, pip install deps, Windows Scheduled Task at 6 PM daily. Posts to @futureproofedge. Needs X Developer account created first. Feb 16. [REPRIORITIZED Feb 18: medium — content supports product, but product comes first.]
cards.launch_prompt: Implement the Build in Public daily auto-post system in C:\Demko_Local_Project\Demko Meta OS 2. Create build_in_public.py that: 1) Runs git log --since=midnight --oneline on the Demko repo, 2) Skips if no commits, 3) Sends commit messages to OpenAI API to draft a layperson-friendly tweet (≤280 chars) emphasizing time saved/cool factor with #BuildInPublic, 4) Posts via Tweepy client.create_tweet(), 5) Appends to tweet_archive.md. Also: create .env with X API key placeholders, pip install tweepy python-dotenv openai, create Windows Scheduled Task for 6 PM daily, test end-to-end.

cards.title: Frontier Signals Pipeline (Twitter/X)
cards.description: Weekly batch: scrape/summarize top 10 builders' Twitter/X feeds → FRONTIER_SIGNALS.md. Referenced during CUV dim 5 retro-check and Frontier Whisper. Solves training-data staleness (red team Theme 4). Uses existing GROK_API_KEY for X API. Integrate into Friday CI Swarm schedule. Output: structured artifact with signals clustered by theme (AI agents, prompt eng, meta-cognitive systems).
cards.launch_prompt: Build frontier_signals.py in C:\Demko_Local_Project\Demko Meta OS 2. It should: 1) Read a curated list of Twitter/X accounts from frontier_builders.txt (one handle per line), 2) Use GROK_API_KEY to fetch recent tweets (last 7 days) from each account, 3) Filter for signal (technical insights, tool announcements, pattern shifts) vs noise (personal, promotional), 4) Cluster signals by theme, 5) Output FRONTIER_SIGNALS.md with structured format: ## Theme > - Signal: [Builder] observation > - Source: tweet URL. 6) Integrate into run_weekly_ci.bat to run alongside CI Swarm on Fridays. Graceful degradation if GROK_API_KEY missing.

cards.title: Build in Public Content Flywheel — CUV Upgrades
cards.description: 5 CUV upgrades implemented: U1 engagement window reminder, U2 constellation format (standalone + quote-tweets), U3 metrics injection (streak/day/time-saved), U4 engagement hit list (5 accounts after posting), U5 blog/index.html with navigation. --dry-run flag added. Feb 17.
cards.launch_prompt: Implement the 5 CUV upgrades for build_in_public.py in C:\Demko_Local_Project\Demko Meta OS 2: U1 Add engagement window reminder (post within 30 min of high-traffic times). U2 Switch from long threads to constellation format (standalone tweets + quote-tweets). U3 Inject streak counter, day number, and time-saved stats into tweet opener. U4 After posting, generate an engagement hit list of 5 accounts to reply to. U5 Create blog/index.html with navigation across all blog posts. Test with --dry-run flag. Commit when done.

cards.title: Google Drive Full Access (OAuth2 + Write Tools)
cards.description: REPLACED domain-wide delegation approach (requires Workspace admin, doesn't work for personal accounts) with OAuth2 user consent flow. One-time browser auth saves token.json with full Drive/Docs/Sheets read+write access. MCP server rewritten v2.0: added gdrive_create_doc, gdrive_upload_file, gdrive_create_folder tools. Falls back to service account (readonly) if token missing. No more per-folder sharing. Feb 17.

cards.title: X Engagement Tracker — Polish & Ship
cards.description: Phase 1-2 complete: engagement_tracker.py, render_engagement.py, influencer_watchlist.json all working. --demo produces 8-tweet dashboard with sparklines, influencer grid, and growth charts. TODO: user feedback pass, test --fetch with live API, --init-watchlist to resolve user IDs, deploy dashboard to GitHub Pages. Feb 16. [DEPRIORITIZED Feb 18: content tooling, not product — revisit after Site Cost Scorecard ships.]

cards.title: Plan & Write Origin Story Narrative
cards.description: Life hacker → factory architect story. 7-act arc planned: (1) The Addiction — 15yr friction-killing pattern, (2) Copywriting Lineage — Ogilvy, Kennedy, Schwartz, Hormozi, (3) The Kyle Moment — zero fracking knowledge → $12M pitch, (4) Human Router Problem — copy-paste between AI tools, (5) Claude Code Arrives — 90/10 flip, (6) Factory Takes Shape — Meta OS with adversarial truth, CUV, 3 surfaces, multi-model red team, (7) Infinite Leverage Thesis — 1% compounding, READ-WRITE 100x. Weave in influence_list.md (30+ names). All source material gathered and reviewed. Ready to write. [DEPRIORITIZED Feb 18: write AFTER Kainos Alpha has a working demo to reference.]

cards.title: Auto-Ingest System
cards.description: auto_ingest.py built: reads accretive_evaluation_report.json, finds INGEST-tagged items, copies to knowledge corpus, updates index. Handles missing files, deduplication. Feb 17.

It should: 1) Read the latest accretive_evaluation_report.json, 2) Find items tagged for INGEST, 3) Copy them into the knowledge corpus (used by knowledge_corpus_rag.py), 4) Update knowledge_corpus_index.json. Follow the INGEST_PIPELINE_CONTRACT__v1.0.md for artifact standards. Test by running it against the current accretive report.

cards.title: Mobile Capture Pipeline
cards.description: End-to-end test: Pixel 9a → Google Recorder → Drive → Claude Code ingestion.

cards.title: Interactive Dashboard Rewrite
cards.description: Complete architectural rewrite of Kanban dashboard. Eliminated fragile 4-step pipeline (edit JSON → python render → copy repo → git push). New version: client-side JS rendering, live GitHub API fetch on load (no more stale cache), clickable Done buttons with hours-saved modal, GitHub API persistence via PAT. One deploy, then all updates happen from the dashboard itself. Feb 16.

cards.title: Collapse Done Section (Show Recent 10)
cards.description: Done section shows only the 10 most recent completed cards by default. 'Show N more' expander button reveals the rest. Feb 17.
cards.launch_prompt: In C:\Demko_Local_Project\Demko Meta OS 2\render_dashboard.py, modify the client-side JS render() function so the Done section only shows the 10 most recent cards initially. Add a 'Show N more' expander button below the visible cards that reveals the rest when clicked. Sort done cards by most recently completed (use card array order as proxy — newest cards are appended last). Style the expander to match existing dashboard aesthetics.

cards.title: MEMORY.md Write Protection (CUV Gate)
cards.description: 3-layer write protection: (1) CLAUDE.md Pre-Flight Gate reclassified (MEMORY.md=TIER 2, CLAUDE.md=TIER 3, LEARNINGS.md=EXEMPT), (2) memory-cuv-gate.sh hook (exit 2 blocking), (3) Self-referential rule in MEMORY.md header. Wired into settings.local.json. Feb 17.
chains: All future MEMORY.md and CLAUDE.md writes
cards.launch_prompt: Implement 3-layer MEMORY.md write protection in C:\Demko_Local_Project\Demko Meta OS 2: (1) In CLAUDE.md Pre-Flight Gate section, reclassify MEMORY.md writes as TIER 2 and CLAUDE.md writes as TIER 3. (2) Create a PreToolUse advisory hook script (memory-cuv-gate.sh) that warns when Edit or Write targets *MEMORY.md or *CLAUDE.md files. (3) Add a self-referential protection rule in the MEMORY.md header. Reference red_team_input_memory_cuv_gate.md for full spec. Prerequisite: LEARNINGS.md must exist first. Commit when done.

cards.title: Fix Claude Code Invalid Settings Files (4 errors)
cards.description: Diagnosed and fixed all invalid Claude Code settings files flagged by /doctor. 3 issue types across 8 files: (A) 6 invalid top-level keys in project settings.json (permissionMode, model, etc), (B) heredoc garbage accidentally saved as Bash permissions in 2 worktree settings, (C) invalid SessionStart/PreCompact hook events in 4 files. All cleaned. Feb 17.

cards.title: Dashboard Upgrade: Dates, Velocity, Timeline + Cloudflare Pages
cards.description: Shipped dashboard upgrade: due date chips, velocity/streak metrics, timeline view, Today filter, actionable task buttons (render_dashboard.py + kanban_data.json schema: created_date, due_date, completed_date, action_url). Set up Cloudflare Pages (demko-dashboard.pages.dev) as fast deploy target (~2s vs GitHub Pages CDN lag). Updated session_close.py with Cloudflare deploy step. Updated Edge startup tabs to Cloudflare URL. Feb 17.

cards.title: Evaluate OpenRouter as Unified API Layer
cards.description: Research whether OpenRouter (1% markup, 200+ models, OpenAI-compatible, caching, auto-fallback) makes sense as a routing layer on top of existing direct API keys (Anthropic, OpenAI, DeepSeek, Poe, Gemini). Would unify billing, add failover, and simplify red_team_review.py multi-model calls. Compare: current direct-to-provider cost vs OpenRouter markup. Low priority — costs aren't a concern, this is an optimization play.
cards.launch_prompt: Research OpenRouter as a unified API routing layer. Compare: (1) Current direct-to-provider costs (Anthropic, OpenAI, DeepSeek, Gemini) vs OpenRouter 1% markup. (2) Feature comparison: caching, auto-fallback, rate limit handling, model availability. (3) Evaluate if red_team_review.py multi-model calls would simplify with OpenRouter's OpenAI-compatible endpoint. (4) Write a recommendation memo to C:\Demko_Local_Project\Demko Meta OS 2\research\openrouter_evaluation.md with a go/no-go verdict and migration plan if go.

cards.title: MCP Wave 1 Install + v3 Close-Out System
cards.description: Installed 4 global MCP servers (Firecrawl, Sequential Thinking, Playwright, Memory) into .claude.json. Built session_close.py deterministic close-out script (render, sync, push both repos, structured JSON report). Upgraded MEMORY.md: v3 close-out protocol (8-step -> 5-step, architecture inversion), tiered expiry tags ([PERMANENT]/[SEASONAL]/[SESSION]), session breadcrumb rule. Red-team reviewed close-out design (3 rounds, strategic-reviewer agent). Feb 17.

cards.title: Install MCP Wave 2 (GitHub, N8n, Brave Search)

N8n skipped — no official MCP package exists, already integrated via webhook in red_team.py. Total: 7 global MCP servers (gdrive, firecrawl, sequential-thinking, playwright, memory, github, brave-search). Verified 7/7 Feb 18.

cards.title: v3 Close-Out System Validated + Session Rehydration Tested
cards.description: Battle-tested v3 close-out protocol end-to-end: session_close.py (render, sync, push x2, Cloudflare), lessons table, LEARNINGS.md append, kanban update, resume state. Discovered nested Claude Code blocker (CLAUDECODE env var) — rehydration requires fresh terminal. Wave 2 MCP confirmed complete (7 global servers). Feb 18.

cards.title: White Space Finder — Kainos Alpha Engine
cards.description: Systematic listening engine that identifies unprecedented market opportunities (kainos alpha) from pain signals. 6-signal filter: Universal + Daily + Emotional + Normalized + Stale Paradigm + AI-Enabled. First 5 opportunities scored: Notification Chaos (9.0), Relationship Decay (8.5), Context Switching Tax (8.0), 'I Saw This Somewhere' Retrieval (8.0), Decision Journal (7.5). Vision: scrape Reddit/X/ProductHunt → LLM filter → score → red team → weekly White Space Report. Integrates with ci_swarm, red_team, Grok, Firecrawl, Brave Search. Feb 18. [SUPERSEDED Feb 18: The white space has been found — Total Occupancy Cost Intelligence. This engine becomes a 'next product' scanner. Revisit after Kainos Alpha v1 ships.]
cards.needs_user: Needs Mike: pick first opportunity to deep-dive
cards.launch_prompt: Build the White Space Finder kainos alpha engine in C:\Demko_Local_Project\Demko Meta OS 2. Create white_space_finder.py that: (1) Scrapes pain signals from Reddit (r/productivity, r/relationships, r/personalfinance), X/Twitter via Grok API, Product Hunt comments, and Brave Search 'I wish there was...' queries. (2) Runs each signal through the 6-filter kainos alpha test (Universal, Daily, Emotional, Normalized, Stale Paradigm, AI-Enabled) using Claude API. (3) Scores each opportunity (1-10 per dimension, minimum 7.0 average to qualify). (4) Outputs a ranked White Space Report as HTML (matching red team report style). (5) Optionally red-teams top 3 via n8n pipeline. Reference topic memory: white_space_finder.md.

cards.title: Gamma Presentation — Video 1 Deck
cards.description: Generated 10-card presentation from video_01_script.md via Gamma MCP. Theme: Founder (dark, minimalist, professional). 16:9 format, medium text, confident tone. 48 Gamma credits used. Available at gamma.app under 'API Generated'. Feb 18.

cards.title: ElevenLabs Voiceover — Video 1 (Mike's Voice)
cards.description: Generated full voiceover for video_01_script.md using Mike's cloned voice (6yF582kBXeHoRFU3ZdLW) via ElevenLabs API. 10 sections, 5.8 MB total. Model: eleven_multilingual_v2. Resolved API key quota issue (had to create new unrestricted key). Output: content/youtube/video_01_script_audio/. Feb 18.

cards.title: Kainos Alpha Thesis — Red Team + Data Validation
cards.description: Wrote kainos_alpha_thesis.md, ran full n8n red team pipeline (o3 + Claude Opus + Grok-3 → DeepSeek R1 + Perplexity). 5 CRITICAL, 5 HIGH, 3 MEDIUM findings. Key kill: Finding #7 — REIT 10-K filings do NOT have submarket-level rent data. Validated by pulling actual Prologis FY2024 10-K + supplemental: 'Southern California' is one line item (551 buildings, 125M SF). Rexford tops at county. STAG/EastGroup/Terreno all metro-level. CoStar ($20K+/yr) or broker comps are the only submarket sources. Original thesis pivot required. Feb 18.

cards.title: Kainos Alpha Pivot — Total Occupancy Cost Intelligence
cards.description: Strategic pivot after REIT data thesis was killed. Old: 'We estimate your rent gap' (requires CoStar). New: 'We calculate total occupancy cost exposure and trajectory, then tell you what to do about it — with audit trail.' Rent = 30-40% of total cost, and the client already knows it. The 60-70% they DON'T know (utilities, labor, taxes, compliance, transport, climate risk) is ALL publicly accessible. 12 data layers identified, all API/scrapeable. White space mapped: nobody combines lease mgmt + market data + decision support for tenants. Pain map: 7 core pain points identified. Feb 18.

cards.title: Define Structured Red Team Input Schema
cards.description: Built red_team_input_schema.json: 8 data layers (BLS labor, EIA utility, FEMA climate, property tax, SEC leases, census permits, transport cost, regulatory burden) each with source, API endpoint, confidence, refresh cadence, assumptions, known gaps, decisions unlocked. 4 decision paths defined (Site Cost Scorecard, Relocation Analysis, Lease Renewal Intelligence, Portfolio Risk Dashboard) with required/optional data layer mapping. Red team instructions structured to output build-order intelligence. Feb 18.

cards.title: Kainos Prompt Re-Index (Factory → Product)
cards.description: Multi-signal ingestion engine: read 6 sources (kainos_alpha_unlock.md, influencer_watchlist.json, kanban_data.json, GitHub trends, Claude Code best practices, CRE public data landscape). Diagnosed: 28/48 cards = infrastructure (factory overbuilt), only 1 card = decision output (bottleneck). Classified all cards into unified frame: Acquire/Validate/Decide/Infra/Content. Output: revised kanban with 5 new product cards, structured red team input schema (8 data layers, 4 decision paths), clear build order. The factory phase is DONE — now building the product. Feb 18.

cards.title: Set Up Claude.ai Projects Architecture (Factory → Product)
cards.description: Map Demko Meta OS (factory) to Claude.ai Projects (products). Decisions needed: (1) Which work streams become standalone Claude.ai Projects? (Flo Health, Weber, Kainos Alpha, Content/YouTube — yes. Setup, dashboard, pipelines — probably not, those stay in factory.) (2) What custom instructions go in each Project? (3) How do lessons flow back to factory? (Memory auto-capture is thin; manual /session-close is thick but requires Code.) (4) Should dashboard 'themes' become 'projects' or stay separate? Themes are operational groupings (meta-os, setup, pipelines); Projects are domain containers (Flo Health, Kainos Alpha). They overlap but aren't identical. (5) Apply Global Protocol Sheet to Settings → Personal Preferences. (6) Load 8 memory edits into Memory Slots. Created during Cowork integration session Feb 18.
cards.needs_user: Needs Mike: theme vs project decision

cards.title: Data Layer #1: BLS Labor Cost Pipeline
cards.description: QCEW CSV API pipeline. 10 demo counties, 8 warehouse NAICS codes, 5-year wage trajectories with CAGR. Tested: Fulton County GA warehousing +6.4%/yr, Couriers +7.8%/yr. CLI: python -m kainos.bls_labor --county 13121 --years 5. Feb 20.
cards.launch_prompt: Build bls_labor_pipeline.py in C:\Demko_Local_Project\Demko Meta OS 2\data_layers\. Steps: (1) Register for BLS API key at https://data.bls.gov/registrationEngine/. (2) Build API client for QCEW (quarterly county-level employment + wages by NAICS) and OES (occupational wages by MSA). (3) Define warehouse-relevant occupation codes: 53-7051 (forklift), 53-7062 (laborers/pickers), 43-5071 (shipping clerks), 11-1021 (managers). (4) Pull 5 years of history for 20 target MSAs (LA, Atlanta, Seattle, Phoenix, Dallas, etc). (5) Store as JSON + CSV with normalized schema: {msa, county, occupation, year, quarter, avg_wage, employment_count}. (6) Add trend calculation (YoY % change). (7) Test with Weber portfolio cities (Atlanta, Seattle, Los Angeles). Reference: red_team_input_schema.json for full data layer spec.

cards.title: Data Layer #2: EIA Utility Rate Pipeline
cards.description: EIA Open Data v2 API pipeline. Industrial electricity + natural gas rates by state with 5-year CAGR. Tested: GA industrial 6.83c/kWh. CLI: python -m kainos.eia_utility --state GA. Feb 20.

cards.title: Data Layer #3: FEMA Climate Risk Pipeline
cards.description: FEMA NRI bulk CSV (85K tracts, 467 cols) + Census Bureau Geocoder pipeline. Address → census tract → 18-hazard risk profile. 9/9 demo sites scored. CLI: python -m kainos.fema_climate --address '3655 Brookside Pkwy, Alpharetta, GA 30022'. Feb 20.

cards.title: Decision Output #1: Site Cost Scorecard
cards.description: 3-layer site scorecard combining BLS labor + EIA utility + FEMA climate into per-site cost profiles with HTML output. 9 demo sites scored across all layers. Signal dedup (top 2 NAICS), graceful EIA fallback. CLI: python -m kainos.site_scorecard --address '...' --county 13121 --label Atlanta --html. Feb 20.

cards.title: Red Team v2: Validate Kainos Alpha with Structured Schema
cards.description: Re-run the Kainos Alpha thesis through the n8n red team pipeline, but this time using the structured input schema (red_team_input_schema.json). Input: all 8 data layers + 4 decision paths + assumptions. Output: prioritized build-order intelligence, not generic critique. The red team validates the data AND tells us which layer to build next. First structured red team run.
cards.launch_prompt: Run structured red team validation. Steps: (1) Read red_team_input_schema.json. (2) Format the 8 data layers + 4 decision paths into a structured prompt following the red_team_instructions in the schema. (3) Fire the n8n webhook (red_team.py) with the structured input. (4) Parse the output: per-data-layer grades, assumption test results, gap severities, and overall build-order recommendation. (5) Compare the red team's recommended build order to our current order (BLS -> EIA -> FEMA -> property tax -> SEC leases). (6) Render the results as an HTML report. (7) Save build-order output for use in prioritizing next sprint.

cards.title: Total Occupancy Cost Variable Map (Deep Research)
cards.description: Comprehensive research deliverable mapping the full warehouse cost stack. Key finding: Prologis ratio ($1 rent = $7 labor = $10 transport). Labor is 45-57% of opex, property tax has 6-8x variance ($450K/yr swing), temp staffing is hidden 13-17% of true labor cost. Reprioritized build order based on impact x accessibility. HTML report + topic memory file saved. Feb 20.

cards.title: Red Team: Cost Taxonomy Variable Completeness (7-Question Adversarial)
cards.description: Full n8n red team pipeline run (o3 + Claude Opus + Grok-3 + Gemini → DeepSeek R1 synthesis) against the entire cost taxonomy variable map. 7 adversarial questions: missing variables, wrong build priorities, persona blind spots, cold chain gap, market timing signals, competitive moat analysis, data staleness reality check. 114KB HTML report generated. Drove the cost_taxonomy.py canonical definitions and informed Phase 2 build order. Feb 20.

cards.title: Data Layer #4: Property Tax Pipeline
cards.description: Tax Foundation 2025 state-level effective rates (50 states). Cost calculator for given building value, 10-year impact, state comparison. 3.3x variance (NJ 2.23% vs TN 0.68%). Integrated into scorecard. CLI: python -m kainos.property_tax --compare GA,TX,NJ,TN --building-value 20000000. Feb 20.

cards.title: Data Layer #5: Labor Availability Pipeline
cards.description: BLS LAUS API v2 (county unemployment) + QCEW warehouse employment depth = tightness score (0-100). Fulton County GA: 3.6% unemployment, 100K warehouse workers, very_tight (95/100). Integrated into scorecard. CLI: python -m kainos.labor_availability --county 13121. Feb 20.

cards.title: Data Layer #6: Temp Staffing Signal Pipeline
cards.description: BLS QCEW NAICS 5613 (Temporary Help Services). Temp staffing concentration vs total employment + hidden agency markup estimate (45% markup on temp payroll). Fulton Co GA: 3.4% concentration, ~$960M/yr county-wide markup. Integrated into scorecard. CLI: python -m kainos.temp_staffing --county 13121. Feb 20.

cards.title: Autonomous Task Batch: 6 Tasks Complete (Leave My Office)
cards.description: Completed 6 autonomous tasks (#4-#9) while user was away. (1) Fixed SSI input_text/text field mismatch in n8n pipeline. (2) Codebase health audit: 16 issues found (1 CRITICAL, 7 HIGH, 5 MEDIUM, 3 LOW). (3) Untracked file catalog: 18 to commit, 8 HTML to gitignore. (4) E2E pipeline verification: fixed async webhook timeout (524 → 0.3s via sequential chaining). (5) Built /lint-config skill with two-pass audit architecture, integrated into /session-close as Step 0. (6) Updated n8n Cloud workflow with async response + Gmail delivery. Two insights graduated to LEARNINGS.md.

cards.title: Claude Surface Architecture Diagram + Routing Clarity
cards.description: 5-iteration visual diagram explaining Mike's multi-surface Claude architecture. Forensic search proved 'Mike OS replaces Demko Meta OS' was NEVER said. Established core rhythm: ideate in Claude.ai (Mike OS project), execute in CLI, manual copy-paste handoff between them. Diagram covers: hero split (Ideate/Execute), name decoder (4 terms), power ranking (#1 CLI, #2 Claude.ai, #3 Claude Code Web = 'The Trap'), decision table, handoff flow, brain maintenance reality (auto vs manual sync), 5 traps to avoid. Located at ~/.agent/diagrams/claude-surface-architecture.html. Feb 20.

cards.title: New Machine Setup Script (setup_new_machine.py)
cards.description: Automated bootstrap for spinning up Demko Meta OS 2 on a new machine. 6-step pipeline: check prerequisites (Python, Node, git, Claude CLI), create directories (~/.claude/), check .env file, run sync_brain.py, offer clipboard copy for Claude.ai paste, run validate_brain.py. Tested clean on primary machine. Only manual step: transfer .env file. Feb 20.

cards.title: Portable Brain v2.0 — Red Team Delivery Gate + Tier Decision Tree
cards.description: Major brain update: added Red Team Delivery Gate (mandatory evaluation at every task completion), Tier Classification Decision Tree (explicit flowchart replacing vibes-based tiering), credential failure mode (FAIL loudly with structured error), Global-First Principle scoped to infra/config only (no longer conflicts with Knowledge Layer Precedence). Hash: 50016965cef8. 5-model red team validated. Feb 20.

cards.title: Brandon — Creative Director Skill + Brand Guide + Skill Creation Methodology
cards.description: Created /brandon skill: Kainos Alpha Creative Director persona with full brand system (Stratos theme, Geist typography, 11-color token system, Flux-1-Pro image formula). Forged through 3 deliberate iterations (Founder=hodgepodge, Pearl=basic, Stratos=identity-first). Origin story baked into skill as instruction set. Red-teamed by 4 models (30 findings, 8 fixes applied). Quality gate: 5 objective heuristics + 3 taste checks. Kill list: 7 anti-patterns that never ship. Extracted reusable Skill Creation Methodology (6-step pattern: real deliverable → iterate failures → document history → extract persona → red team persona → ship as asset). Methodology artifact saved to memory. Future vision: skills as rentable encapsulated expertise in a marketplace. Feb 20.

cards.title: Weber — Forensic RE Analyst Skill (Skill #2)
cards.description: Created /weber skill: Forensic Real Estate Analyst persona forged through Weber Logistics engagement. 3-iteration origin story (Rate Table→$3.8M Headline→Dollarized Scorecard). Core insight: 'rate × consumption assumption = annual cost' is the universal multiplication that turns data into decisions. 10-lens forensic audit framework, 7-layer data pipeline (BLS/EIA/FEMA/Tax/Labor/Temp/Incentives), 4-layer output architecture (hero number, cost table, trajectory, material risks). 9 anti-patterns in kill list. Quality gate: 8 objective checks + 5 judgment checks. Mode detection for 9 trigger patterns (audit/scan/scorecard/redline/stress-test/kill-case/portfolio/deck/full). Second skill built using the Brandon-forged methodology. Feb 20.
